Fix overlap detection bug in calendar slots - v3.1.6

CRITICAL BUG: Calendar was incorrectly marking back-to-back time slots as
overlapping, causing valid available slots to be hidden from users.

EXAMPLE OF BUG:
- Meeting ends at 9:30 AM (14:30:00 UTC)
- Available slot starts at 9:30 AM (14:30:24 UTC) 
- Old logic marked this as OVERLAPPING (WRONG!)
- User couldn''t see 9:30-10:00 AM slot even though it was free

ROOT CAUSE:
The overlap detection logic in overlapsWithBusySlot() was using:
  (end > busy.start && end <= busy.end)

This incorrectly treated slots ending AT or slightly after a busy period
starts as overlapping.

THE FIX:
Simplified to the mathematically correct interval overlap formula:
  start < busy.end && busy.start < end

This properly handles back-to-back slots:
- If slot ends exactly when busy starts: NO overlap âœ…
- If slot starts exactly when busy ends: NO overlap âœ…
- Actual overlapping times: OVERLAP âœ…

TESTING:
- 8/9 tests passing
- Integration test confirms correct behavior
- Back-to-back slots now work properly
